park_comments.text: Opening of Monument rescheduled from 03 April to 27 April due to unseasonable weather and additional maintainence.
Closed March 7 and 21 due to inclement weather - snowfall.Special events held March 1, 2, 10, 24, and 31.
Outdoor monument is closed until April 2018 (winter). Kwanzaa events took place for three days.
October 3 - October 7 10 Anniversary of dedication of outdoor memorial
Monument re-opened 17 June 2017 for public access. Junteenth celebration same day.

Outdoor memorial closed for the safety of visitors and to facilitate facade repairs on the adjoining 290 Broadway.Special Event April 15, 2017 - Attendance 38 personsA Film Screening of "I Know A Man ... Ashley Bryan"

2 MarchMemorial opened for group led by architect Rodney Leon.3 MarchTwo representing the Korea National Park Service visit AFBG.11 MarchCraft Workshop held - 26 visitors14 March Closed due to heavy snowfall16 MarchFront entrance of Visitor Center closed by GSA due to falling ice and snow.18 MarchPoetry Workshop held - 35 visitors25 March Author Talk held - 40 people30 March Screening of Freedom Riders held - 30 people

February 2017:1st - Live Interviews conducted with New York City Department of Parks and Recreation through Facebook Live and Periscope via Twitter4th - Off-Site at the Hetrick-Martin Institute's Queens LGBTQ Teen Summit9th - Snow Closure16th - Screening of Passage at St. Augustine with a discussion afterward with filmmaker Clennon King18th - Dual screenings of Maya Angelou: And Still I Rise in partnership with the United Nations Remember Slavery Programme and with a discussion with co-director Rita Coburn Whack20th - Special Opening for President's Day holiday21st - Dance and Theatrical Performance by Eclectic Butterfly Dance Theatre22nd - Off-site at Kings County Supreme Court
January 16 opened visitor center for Dr. Martin Luther King Jr. Day and held two film screenings.
Closed 3 December due to building maintenance.Every Kid in a Park event held 15 December.24 December - 3:45pm early closureKwanzaa special events held on 27-30 December.
Closed Thursday November 24 for Thanksgiving.Outdoor memorial closed for winter season on November 1 and will reopen April 1, 2017.
25th Anniversary Event October 5-7, 2016Open House New York October 15, 2016

April 23, 2015 - African Burial Ground celebrated Bring Your Child to Work Day with a special program with 14 attendees.

March 5, 2015 - Closed at 1pm due to snowfallMarch 6, 2015 - Opened at 11am due to extant snow accumulationMarch 21, 2015 - Meditation and Craft "Twin" Workshop w/ 11 participantsMarch 25, 2015 - Dramatic performance of "The Flight" w/ 75 visitorsMarch 31, 2015 - Memorial opened for a visit by international dignitaries.

African American History Month Programs2 attendees - Feb, 7 Noon: Screening of Frederick Douglass: An American Life12 attendees - Feb 11, 1PM: Lecture by Herb Boyd2 attendees - Feb 12, Noon: Screening of Spirit of a Culture: Cane River Creoles3 attendees - Feb 14, Noon: Screening of The City that Lit the World4 attendees - Feb 17, Noon: Screening of Booker T. Washington: The Life and the Legacy200 attendees - Feb 19, 11AM-4PM: A Reenactment and Commemoration of the 150th Anniversary of the 26th U.S. Colored Troops8 attendees - Feb 21, Noon: Screening of Never Lose Sight of Freedom10 attendees - Feb 27, 12:30PM: Dramatic performance by David Mills on the works of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr.

Youth Week Celebration Day 1 on October 1, 2014Youth Week Celebration Day 2 on October 2, 2014Youth Week Celebration Day 3 on October 3, 2014Youth Week Celebration Day 4 on October 4, 2014Open House New York on October 11, 2014
Howard University group of 250 visited Sept 20

The African Burial Ground National Monument celebrated Juneteenth, on June 19, 2014, which is the oldest known celebration commemorating the end of slavery in the United States. The African Burial Ground National Monument celebrated Pinkster on June 21, 2014, which is a  spring festival, taking place in late May or early June. The name is a variation of the Dutch word Pinksteren, meaning "Pentecost". Pinkster in English almost always refers to the festivals held by African Americans (both free and slave) in the Northeastern United States, particularly in the early 19th centuryThe African Burial Ground National Monument participated in the "Night at the Musuems'' where visitors were able to visit historic landmarks and musuems in lower Manhattan, at night and free of charge.

On Saturday, May 17, 2014 The African Burial Ground National Monument participated in National Kids to Parks Day ! The day was commemorated with dance performances, arts and crafts workshops, and face painting.

Memorial remains closed due to weather related hazards. UN/NPS Film Screening -March 8, 2014 Memorial Opened for Blue Nile Passage Group - March 15, 2014 UN Sustainable Theatre Workshop - March 22, 2014

Memorial remains closed due to weather related hazards. Two hour delayed opening due to weather - February 5, 2014 Black History Month Gallery Talk - February 7, 2014 Black History Month African Bead Workshop - February 8, 2014 Black History Month Film Screenings (2)- February 11, 2014 Black History Month Gallery Talk - February 11, 2014 Site Closure due to weather - February 13, 2014 Two hour delayed  ooening due to weather - February 14, 2014 Black History Month Roots of Insipration (music) program - February 15, 2014 Black History Month Female Leadership program - February 20, 2014Black History Month Puppet Person workshop - February 22, 2014 Desmund Tutu visit the AFBG - February 25, 2014 Black History Month Musical Griot performance - February 25, 2014 Black History Month Gallery Talk - February 27, 2014 Black History Month Film Screening - February 27, 2014 Black History Month Genarlogy Program - February 28, 2014

Memorial remains closed due to weather related hazards. Site closure due to weather -January 3, 2014 Premier of Nevis, Vnace Amory visits AFBG - January 9, 2014 Early closure of site due to weather (closed at 2:00pm) - January 21, 2014 Two hour delayed opening due to weather - January 22, 2014

December 7, 2013, African Burial Ground National Monument was closed due to electrical maintenance being conducted by GSA. December 13, 2013, African Burial Ground National Monument was closed at 3pm for staff holiday party. December 14, 2013, Dr. Joy DeGruy presented a lecture titled, "Post-traumatic Slave Syndrome"December 24, 2013, African Burial Ground National Monument closed at 1pm on Christmas Eve. December 26-28, African Burial Ground National Monument celebrated Kwanzaa and the 10th anniversary of the Rites of Ancestral Return. The outdoor memorial was open during this time.

On November 16, 2013, National Park Service Director Jon Jarvis visits the African Burial Groun National Monument On November 17, 2013, The African Burial Ground National Monument  memorial was until April 1, 2014. The memorial was closed due to safety concerns during the winter months.
The African Burial Ground NM was closed from October 1-16, 2013  due to the Government Shutdown.
On August 28, the African Burial Ground National Monument celebrated the 50th Anniversary of the March on Washington.
On June 19, 2013, The African Burial Ground National Monument celebrated Juneteenth, which is the oldest known celebration commemorating the ending of slavery in the United States.

On Wednesday May 8, 2013 there were flash foods and heavy rain, which contributed to low visitation at the African  Burial Ground National Monument. On Saturday,  May 18, 2013 The African Burial Ground National Monument  participated in National Kids to Parks Day.

On Tuesday, March 19, 2013, The African Burial Ground Memorial was closed due to icy conditions. On Thursday, March 28, 2013 The African Burial Ground National Monument celebrated Women's History Month, with a program titled, "A history of Black Women in Architecture".  The speaker was architect Roberta Washington, who designed the African Burial National Monument Visitor Center.

February 3, 2013 - The memorial was closed due to snow and ice conditions. February 5, 2013 - The memorial was closed due to snow and ice conditions.February  8, 2013 - The memorial was closed due to ice conditions, and the Visitor Center closed at 1PM due to winter storm Nemo. February 9 -10, 2013 - The African Burial Ground National Monument was closed due to winter storm Nemo. February 11-13, 2013 - The African Burial  Ground National Monument was closed due to snow and ice condition. During the month of February, the African Burial Ground National Monument  celebrated Black History Month.  Six activities were scheduled.

January 1, 2013 - The African Burial Ground NM Visitor Center was closed because there were no guards scheduled to work New Year's Day. January 8, 2013 - National Archaeology Day was observed at the  African Burial Ground NM.January 16, 2013 - The African Burial Ground NM Memorial closes at 4PM for the winter months. January 24-27, 2013 - The African Burial Ground NM Memorial is closed per orders  of Department of Homeland Security.

Special Notes:On December 5, 2012 The camera/reflection was not working properly. On December 7,2012 the video for the theatre stopped working ( midday) . The audio was working  properly. Beginning on Friday,  December 21, 2012 The African Burial Ground National Monument (Outside Memorial) will close at 4:00 PM. On December 26, 2012, the African Burial Ground National Monument was closed at 3:30 PM due to inclement weather by the Chief of Operations Tom O'Connell. On  December 28, 2012 the African Burial Ground National  Monument  had their annual Kwanzaa Celebration. On December 29, 2012, , the African Burial Ground National Monument (Outside Memorial)was closed at 1:30 PM due to inclement weather by the Chief of Operations Tom O'Connell.

October 28, 2012 - November 11, 2012  - African Burial Ground remained closed due to Hurricane SandyNovember 17, 2012- The "Reflections" station camera was inoperativeNovember 20, 2012- The "Reflections" station camera was inoperativeNovember 20, 2012  - The lights did not come on at the Memorial. November 22, 2012 - The African Burial Ground was closed for Thanksgiving DayNovember 27, 2012  - The lights did not come on at the Memorial.

October 1 , 2012 The memorial was closed for renovations. October 2, 2012 The memorial was closed for renovations. October 2, 2012 - October 7, 2012  The African Burial Ground Participated in Youth Week, 23 activities were held. October 3, 2012 The memorial was closed for renovations. October 4, 2012 The memorial reopened to the public at 12 noon. October 6, 2012 Ranger Doug Massenburg participated in an Off-Site program at Bed-Stuy Alive Collective. October 6, 2012 - October 7, 2012  there were four special activities for Open House NY. October 13, 2012 - The African Burial Ground and Memorial were closed due to a power outage by GSA. October 28, 2012 Memorial closed at 3PM due to Hurricane Sandy. October 29, 2012 - October 31, 2012 The African Burial Ground NM closed due to Hurricane Sandy.

In September, African Burial Ground was closed early due to predictions of severe weather on the 8th. The memorial is closed due to renovations, it is scheduled to reopen on October 4, 2012. Though the memorial is closed due to renovations, rangers stationed at the memorial answer questions  of visitors and those who are passing by.

The African Burial Ground Memorial was closed for maintenance on July 18, 2012 and is scheduled to  reopen on October 4, 2012. Though the memorial is closed, rangers stationed at the memorial answer questions of the public, in addition to allowing the public to see a portion of the memorial which is fairly unobstructed.
Women's History Month.  Special book signing at African Burial Ground National Monument by Dr. Zetta Elliott of Manhattan College.  There were 55 participants.
Labor Day, September 5, 2011:  African Burial Ground National Monument closed to the public because of the holiday.
August 23, 2011:  The park closed early due to the effects of an earthquake in Virginia.  August 28-29, 2011:  The park closed to the public due to a hurricane in New York.
Independence Day, July 4, 2011:  The African Burial Ground National Monument closed to the public because of the holiday.

Special Event:  June 6, 2011:  Manhattan Sites Seasonal Orientation at AFBG. June 9, 2011:  Park participation off-site at the 5th Annual Bedford-Stuyvesant Resource and Safety Expo in Brooklyn, New York.  June 18, 2011: Juneteenth Celebration featuring Joe Becton of Becton Tours and Historical Services. AFBG Off-Site Presentation for Juneteenth Celebration at Malcolm Shabazz Mosque and MLK Jr. New York Support Group in Harlem, New York.

Memorial Day, May 30, 2011:  The African Burial Ground National Monument closed to the public because of the holiday.  Also, three special programs were provided for the public during the month:  The Archeology Program, "A Broader View:  Exploring the African Presence in Early New York" walking tour, and the "Abolitionist Walking Tour."

African Burial Ground National Monument sponsored 11 activities/workshops for three special events during the month of April:  National Park Week, National Junior Ranger Day, and Take Our Daughters and Sons to Work Day.

African Burial Ground National Monument closed to the public due to a snowstorm on February 1, 2011, and for Presidents' Day on February 21, 2011. Also, the memorial closed to the public for numerous days throughout the month due to snow and icy conditions.SPECIAL EVENTS: February 7, 2011, Gateway National Recreation Area Black History Month Staff Development Day at African Burial Ground National Monument; and, 14 activities/programs were conducted throughout the month for the general public which included gallery talks, afternoon film series, a family memory box workshop, and a program about African textiles.

African Burial Ground National Monument Memorial operated on a different schedule during the month of January. The memorial closed on each Sunday except January 30, 2011. Due to snowstorms, the park closed to the public on several days in January.Also, African Burial Ground National Monument closed to the public on New Year's Day, and for the observance of Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Birthday on January 17, 2011. Finally, the memorial closed on numerous days throughout the month due to snow and icy conditions.

African Burial Ground National Monument Memorial closed to the public on Sundays beginning December 5, 2010.  And, the park closed to the public for several days in December due to inclement weather. Also, African Burial Ground National Monument closed to the public in observance of Christmas on December 24, 2010, Christmas Day, and for the observance of New Year's Day on December 31, 2010.			SPECIAL EVENTS, December 18, 2010:  Reading and Presentation of Official Pinkster Proclamation.  December 28, 2010:  Kwanzaa Celebration. Canceled due to blizzard in New York City.

SPECIAL EVENT, October 1-5, 2010: Youth Week (continued). Activites for youths and families included Art Tours, Afternoon Film Series, Archaeology Workshop, Drumming on the Memorial Grounds, slavery exhibit entitled, "Lest We Forget," and a Memorial Talk.

SPECIAL EVENTS,September 18, 2010:  "Archaeology and the Public in New York," Organized by Wenner-Gren sponsored Dynamics of Inclusion Public Archaeology Workshop and the African Burial Ground National Monument.	September 18, 2010: Special presentation of children's book "Jalani and the Lock" by playwright, Dr. Lorenzo Pace. September 29-30, 2010:  Celebration of Youth Week. Activities included Art Tours, Film Series, and Our Story Through Dance.

SPECIAL RECOGNITION, August 23, 2010: International Day for the Remembrance of the Slave Trade and its Abolition.  The park laid wreaths on the burial mounds outdoors to honor and commemorate the lives of an estimated 15,000 captive and freed Africans who are buried in the African Burial Ground cemetery.
SPECIAL EVENT,June 19, 2010:  "Juneteenth Lecture" by Dr. Joy DeGruy on the history and significance of celebrating emancipation and the ending of slavery.

SPECIAL EVENTS,   April 22, 2010:  "Take Our Daughters and Sons to Work Day."   Premiere of African Burial Ground National Monument Junior Ranger Program.   April 24, 2010:  National Junior Ranger Day

SPECIAL EVENTS,February 16, 2010:  Black History Month Celebration.  Special programs consisted of Finding African Roots in Puerto Rico Through the Art of Doll Making, and The Evolution of the Blues.  February 27-28, 2010:  New Visitor Center Grand Opening.

SPECIAL EVENT,December 29, 2009:  Kwanzaa (An African American celebration of family, community, and culture).  Activities included Arts and Crafts Workshop, a dance performance by students from the Impact Repertory Theater, and an interactive African drumming presentation.

SPECIAL EVENT, October 1-4, 2009:  Youth Week.  The celebration consisted of numerous activities designed for youths and families which included walking tours, Children's Story Time, Uncovering the Story of the Burial Ground Through Archeology, Arts and Crafts Workshops, and dance performances.
Tram didn't start running until end of May
No tram running in April
Tram not running in March
Great weather - trail users from Lilly
Lot of rain this last month.
Includes Bluestone State Park hikers, Pipestem hikers, and visitors to Lily.
tram was off-line for approximately 1.5 week for repair
tram closed for the winter.
The tram has been closed for thee winter season.
The tram has not reopened from the winter.
Tram was closed for the winter.
Last year the tram didn't open until May 12th.

The tram at Pipestem Resort State Park opened May 12, reducing visitation earlier in the month. Normally it opens May 1st. Last year the tram was closed for repairs all month except for Memorial Day weekend. Therefore this year's May visitation was less than normal but more than last year.
Gas prices and general economic woes
gas prices and poor weather
In July 2004 the tram was out of service for the first 12 days of the month. In July 2005, the tram was in service all month, resulting in a large increase when compared to July 2004.

In June of 2004 the tram was only open for half the month. Also, in May of 2005, (last month) the tram was only open over Memorial Day weekend. These factors account for the apparant increase in visitation in June 2005.
The tram was out of service for all but the last five days of the month.
Government shut down over the weekend of January 19-22.
Battle of Gettysburg anniversary July 1-3.1st Amendement activities on July 1.
First full month with information desk in new location.
A new information desk began operating near the entrance of the Museum & Visitor Center.
Park closed one day for significant snow storm.
Record warm temperatures for the month of February.
The Visitor Center saw increased traffic due to the Inauguration and the marches in DC.
Traffic data was not able from Denver at time of report.
West Confederate traffic counter broken for 1/2 of Novmber. Estimate used.
Traffic counter on West Confederate broken.
Traffic counter was broken for the first two weeks of July (over the battle anniversary/4th of July weekend).History Nerds CUA did not report visitor numbers.

Both traffic counters were broken and traffic information was not able to be downloaded at the time of reporting. Estimates were used from Estimation Tool.History Nerds did not report their June visitor numbers.
History Nerds (CUA holder) did not report visitor numbers for May.
The West Confederate Ave Traffic Counter was inoperable to first 16 days of the month.  The months total number was averaged from the 13 full days that were collected.
The West Confederate Ave Traffic Counter malfunctioned for six days.  The total monthly number is an estimate based the 25 days it operated correctly.
The Hancock Ave Traffic Counter was inoperable for the month of September.  The estimated number of vehicles that traveled on Hancock Ave was 20019 vehicles.

The West confederate Ave traffic counter failed to record data this month due to a battery power issue. Historically West Confederate Ave receives 87% of that traffic as Hancock Ave.  The estimated monthly traffic for West Confederate Ave is 23,644.
Traffic Data was based from a five year average.  The Denver Service Center has been unable to process the traffic data due to lack of staffing.
Due to staffing shortages at the Denver Service Center, data from the Traffic Counters can not be processed.  The numbers entered in for the traffic counters are based on a five year average.
The traffic data was estimated based on a five year average.  The Denver Service Center does not have adequate staffing to process the traffic data from the GETT traffic counters.
The traffic numbers are based on the parks five year average.  The data from the traffic counters can not be processed due to staffing issues at the Denver Service Center.
Hancock Ave. traffic data was unable to be processed. Based on past averages compared to West Confederate Ave., Hancock Ave's estimated vehicle count is 9442 vehicles.
Hancock Ave Traffic Counter was frozen shut. Estimated vehicle count for Hancock Ave is 5281 vehicles, base on prior months average for Hancock Ave compared to West Confederate Ave (81%).
The West Confederate Traffic Counter malfunctioned for five days, the total number for the month was estimated from the remaining 26 days that were counted.

The West Confederate Traffic Counter malfunctioned and did not collect traffic data.  The month prior Hancock Ave experienced 87% of the traffic West Confederate Ave did. Based on that percentage, the traffic data for West Confederate Ave was estimated at 24250.

The traffic counter for West Confederate continued to malfunction for the month of July.  Traffic numbers were estimated based on Hancock Ave Traffic numbers, that historically run at 99.97% of West Confederate.  The Traffic counter was repaired on July 31, 2014.

The West Confederate Ave Traffic Counter was inoperable for the month of June.  I have been in touch with the Park Facility Management Program out of Denver and plan to have the counter operating correctly by August 2014.The traffic numbers for West Confederate were estimated off of the 99.97% difference from Hancock Ave the month prior.
West Confederate Traffic inoperable for the first 17 days of the month.  Total traffic numbers for West Confederate for the month based off of the 14 day average.

The traffic counter on West Confederate Ave stopped working on December 11th.  The first ten days data of the month averaged 82% of Hancock Avenues Traffic Numbers.  Monthly estimate of 82% equals an estimate of 5766 vehicles traveling along West Confederate for the month of December.
Park closed from OCT 1-16 due to Government shutdown
The West Confederate Traffic Data Counter malfunctioned for the first 13 days of August.  Those days were averaged based of the vehicle numbers from the rest of the month.

The West Confederate Traffic Counter failed to work during the month of July.  Historically West Confederate has 74% of the traffic that Hancock Ave has.  The approximate traffic data for West Confederate is 41904.  The traffic counter should be repaired for the month of August.

The West Confederate Ave Traffic Counter stopped working from June 7 to the beginning of July.  Traffic numbers for the rest of June were calculated based off the 74% of travel West Confederate saw in comparison to the traffic on Hancock Ave from June 1-7.
For unknown reason the traffic counter on West Confederate was inoperable for eleven hours.  The traffic counter seems to be operating correctly now.
Hancock Ave Traffic Counter was inoperable from April 1-12.  Traffic counter numbers for those days was projected from the remaining monthly data.
Hancock Ave Traffic Counter was inoperable due to power surge.  Last three days data for Hancock Ave was projected based on daily average of vehicle traffic.
The traffic counter on Hancock Ave was inoperable for the first six days of August.  The numbers for those days were averaged from the 25 days of good traffic data that was recieved.
The traffic counter on Hancock Avenue broke half way through the month of July.  The traffic counter has since been replaced and the traffic for August will be correct.
Visitor Center door counter edited due to incorrect data being reported.
Hancock Avenue traffic counter repaired and in service
The traffic counter on Hancock Avenue was out of service until March 15, 2011. Total number of vehicles on Hancock Avenue is estimated.
Hancock Avenue traffic counter not working. Number estimated based on increase on West Confederate Avenue and multiplying previous year's count.

Hancock Avenue counter is still not functional (should be up in March). Calculated a 10.82% decrease from 2010 to 2011 on the West Confederate counter so did the same for Hancock Avenue - arrived at 5014.

Hancock Avenue counter remains non-functioning. I calculated an 8.8% increase in the West Confederate counter between 2009 & 2010. I took the 2009 Hancock number of 5203, multiplied by .088 to get final estimate of 5661.

Due to the lack of a traffic counter at Hancock Avenue, we had to estimate the numbers for November.  I compared the W. Confederate counter numbers back to July, which was the last month we had good numbers for Hancock Avenue. There was a 65% decrease in those numbers.  So I took Hancock Avenue's numbers for July and subtracted 65%.

Due to the lack of a traffic counter at Hancock Avenue, we had to estimate the numbers for October.  I compared the W. Confederate counter numbers back to July, which was the last month we had good numbers for Hancock Avenue. There was a 32% decrease in those numbers.  So I took Hancock Avenue's numbers for July and subtracted 32%.

Due to a lightning strike taking out the Hancock Traffic Counter and a road maintenance project, relocating the road loops, this month is estimated.  I compared the W. Confederate traffic counts in September to July and saw a 39.5 decrease in traffic.  I took my estimates for Hancock in July and reduced those numbers by 39.5% to get an estimate for the month.

Due to a lightning strike taking out the Hancock Traffic Counter and a road maintenance project, relocating the road loops, this month's figure for the Hancock counter were estimated.  I compared the W. Confederate traffic counts in August and July and saw a 6% decrease in traffic.  I took my estimates for Hancock in July and reduced those numbers by 6% to get an estimate for Hancock for this month.

Due to the loss of data on the Hancock Avenue traffic counter, I was forced to estimate the total cars on Hancock Avenue for July.  I did this by using the daily averages for each day that we did show data and inputting those for days we had no data.
Our Visitor counts were real low for february due to a great many days where the park was closed due to excessive amounts of snow.

Due to changing multipliers as a result of a recent Person-Per-Vehicle survey, our percentages of rise or fall are not true measures of the actual rise and fall in 2009.  Beginning with January 2010 our numbers will have been in effect for a year and we'll be getting a more reliable picture of our percentages.

Beginning with January 2010 our numbers will have been in effect for a year and we'll be getting a more reliable picture of our percentages.

David Willis House opened. Acquired in 2000 & the $7.2 mill project to convert it to a museum is almost done.-------------------------------------------------------Due to changing multipliers as a result of a recent Person-Per-Vehicle survey, our percentages of rise or fall are not true measures of the actual rise and fall in 2009.  Beginning with January 2010 our numbers will have been in effect for a year and we'll be getting a more reliable picture of our percentages.

Due to changing multipliers as a result of a recent Person-Per-Vehicle survey, our percentages of rise or fall are not true measures of the actual rise and fall in 2009.  Beginning with January 2010 our numbers will have been in effect for a year and we'll be getting a more reliable picture of our percentages.
Sep 27: The new VC will start charging admission fee for museum, film & view the painting.
Adjustments to the Visitation Formula were made where as the counts for the National Cemetery are no longer being made.  This will have a minimal effect on the yearly numbers.

These figures may be high due to the fact that the cemetery is no longer across the street from the Visitor Center.  We're looking into a method of estimating the numbers that are visiting the National Cemetery.  When the decision is made, I will edit all of the months since the new visitor center has been open.

The only thing skewed on June's numbers have to do with Visitor Hours.  As the new Visitor Center isn't run by the NPS, we haven't been receiving any door counts for the building.  So far all we are getting are the multimedia program numbers.  This does not affect the number of visits.FYI: 576 acres of trees are being removed since they did not exist at the time of the battle. And 275 acres to be planted with trees & orchards that have disappeared, 39 miles of fencing to be erected.
Cyclorama Center is permanently closed.  And as for the Visitor Center Door Counts, the counts are being done by shopper track and we haven't figured on how to get the numbers from them.

April was the first month in the new Visitor Center.  The first day was the 14th.  They have yet to get the visitor Counters installed inside the new building.  So the visitor count for the Visitor Center, and the program counts, are only for the first 13 days of the month.
Cyclorama Center has been permenantly CLOSED.
Cyclorama Center is permanently closed to the public.

The Cyclorama Center is closed for good.  The Cyclorama Program in the future will be sold as a group ticket with the new Visitor Center Orientation video.  There will be one ticket and the counts will be for the combination of the two programs.
Cyclorama Center was closed to the public since mid November and the Cyclorama Painting has been closed for over a year while the painting undergoes restoration.

Cyclorama Program was closed to the public during the month of May.  Also broken wire to the Hancock Avenue traffic counter caused the use of some estimates toward the missing daily numbers.  Those estimates were based on the rise or fall in the Visitor Center building counuts in relationship to May of 2005.  This figure was a difference of -3%.

Half of the months traffic counter reading for Hancock Avenue had to be estimated due to dead battery.  Estimates were achieved using the daily averages listed at the bottom of the Monthly Traffic Counter Report for Hancock Avenue. Also, the Cyclorama Center was totally closed to the public for the entire month of December, 2005.

Two items which need to be noted are the fact that the Cyclorama Center closed to the public as of November 20th, and the traffic counter on Hancock Avenue went down early in the month.  For the purpose of the report, I compared the traffic figures for West Confederate Avenue from this year as compared to November of 2004.  There was an increase of 3% on that road.  Therefore to come up with a fairly close estimate, I took the traffic count for Hancock Avenue in November of 2004 and multiplied it by 3%, coming up with the figure that I placed in the count for Hancock Avenue, November 2005.

Crane Flat campground was closed 5 nights due to a wildland fire beginning August 27th.  Tamarack Flat campground closed due to a wildland fire beginning August 31st and will not reopen this season. ALso closd was a portino of Highway 120, Crane Flat CG, Big Oak Flat Road.Aug 26-28: rockfall closed the Ahwahnee Hotel.

Wawona Campground reopened on June 21st after being closed for two months for a paving project.south Entrance and Big Trees counter out for 7 days.Badger Pass counter out for 30 days.Lower Pines Campground was closed for 7 days due to paving project.Tuolumne Campground opened for the season on June 19th.White Wolf Campground opened on June 19th.Tamarack Flat Campground opened June 23rd.Crane Flat Campground opened June 18th.
Wawona campground closed 29 days for paving, only open 2 nights.  Tioga Pass opened 5/20
Mar 8: a large rockfall (43,000 cubic meters or 115,000 tons) from Ahwiyah Point closes the southern portion of the Mirror Lake loop trail. Impact was the equivalent of a 2.4 earthquake.

Tamarack Flat closed 10/10, Porcupine Flat closed 10/15.A rockslide caused 233 of 600 tent or cabins at Curry Village closed permanently because of unstable cliff. Same place as the 1996 rockslide. This will effect number of concession lodging o/n stays.FYI: from 1996 to present, the total number of hotel rooms, cabins and campsites has decreased by 36%, from 2,353 to 1,503. Only 464 campsites remain, about half of what was there before the 1997 flood.
Bridalveil and Yosemite Creek CG closed 9/2, White Wolf closed 9/15

BOF traffic counter now uses correct inbound figures.  Used lane 2 in error from beginning/instillation. Inbound/outbound reversed, but now corrected.July 25-31: Fires affected west entrance as highway 140 shut down temporarily. Also Yosemite Lodge lost power for a few days.FYI: tour buses not allowed since 2006 due to rock slide.FYI: backcountry overnight stays are 40,000; only 10,000 in 2007.

Crane Flat, White Wolf, Yosemite Creek and Tuolumne Meadows campgrounds opened for the season on 6/20/08.  Tamarack Flat campground opened for the season on 6/24/08.Jun 15: Beartooth Highway re-opened again. It's been closed more than it has been open since Memorial Day. It is the section of US 212 at the NE entrance and  between Red Lodge MT and Cooke City.Jun 27: new bridge across the Merced River near Highway 140 allows vehicles up to 45 feet. The interim bridge after the April 2006 rockslide only allowed 28ft vehicles - no tour buses, construction vehicles or large RVs.FYI: backcountry overnight stays are 24,000; only 7,000 in 2007.
Tioga Pass opened for season 5/21, closed  temp Memorial Day weekend due to snow.
Tioga Pass closed 12/7.Dec 18: rockslides close Northside Drive.
White Wolf closed 9/17Yosemite Creek closed 9/3
Tuol, YOS CK, WW and Tamarac CG not open yet
Lower Pines Campground opened  3/23
Tioga Pass closed 11/27 through the end of month
Areas closed: HHES 10/26, NPCG 10/9, TamCG 10/12, PorcCG 10/14, CFCG 10/9
Hwy 140 west of Arch Rock opened for traffic on 8/18, had been opened only from the east.  Concession count edited later 9/12 to reflect correct count from 24405 to 114159

Yosemite Creek and Porcupine Flat campgrounds opened July 12th,the count for the Hetch Hetchy and Camp 4 camgrounds are number of people. Hwy 140 was closed to all traffic due to rock slide. Arch Rock was open for administrative, residents and hotel guests staying in El Portal.  Concession lodging edited to correct number 9/12/06--from 28,862 to 113,315

Tioga Pass opened 6/17; Tamarack CG opened 6/20; Crane Flat CG opened 6/26; White Wolf & Bridalveil CGs opened 6/30. Hwy 140 is still closed due to a rockslide, altho the Arch Rock entrance is open to visitors staying in El Portal accommodations, residents and administrative traffic.

Rockslide on Hwy 140 (Arch Rock entrance) closed all month with the exception of 5/25. The road opened at 0600 and closed again at 1900 hrs, traffic count is for those hours only.  Mariposa Grove (Big Trees) opened 5/5. YV backpacker CG had limited use for few weeks due to flooded bridge.
Badger Pass closed 4/3; North Pines CG opened 4/7. Weather wet & cold first 2 weeks of April
Lower Pines CG opened 3/24/06.
Unusually nice weather, but didn't seem to make the stats look good. Arch Rock traffic counter was out 14 days.
Tioga Pass closed for the season on 11/25.
No report from Tioga Pass traffic counter. Porcupine Flat CG closed 10/5; Crane Flat CG closed 10/11.

Arch Rock, Badger Pass, & Tioga Pass traffic counters look like they're still having problems.Tamarack & Yosemite Creek CGs closed 9/4; Bridalveil closed 9/5; White Wolf closed 9/17; and Tuolumne closed 9/26.
Traffic counters at Arch Rock, South Entrance, and Big Trees appear to be out-of-order; traffic counts are estimates only. Tioga Pass corrected to 0 veh and broken counter 9/06

Bridalveil & Tuolume Campground opened 7/8; Tamarack CG opened 7/1; Yosemite Creek & Porcupine CGs opened 7/15; White Wolf CG opened 7/22. Backcountry permits had some computer problems. Arch Rock and Big Trees traffic counters were out all month; South Entrance and Badger Pass were out some of the month.
No traffic counts from Tioga Pass or Big Trees. Tioga Pass opened 6/24/05. Crane Flat CG opened 6/30/05. 		5 areas have no camping due to lots of snow from winter 2004-05.
For Badger Pass - Glacier Pt Rd opened 5/23. Tioga Pass still closed due to snow.
Broken counter at Arch Rock. Tioga Road and Badger Pass road closed due to snow. Wawona group sites opened 4/22; North Pines opened 4/8.
